sn35.136:1.1: “Mendicants, gods and humans like sights, they love them and enjoy them.
sn35.136:1.2: But when sights perish, fade away, and cease, gods and humans live in suffering.
sn35.136:1.8: thoughts, they love them and enjoy them.
sn35.136:1.9: But when thoughts perish, fade away, and cease, gods and humans live in suffering.
sn35.136:1.10: The Realized One has truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape of sights, so he doesn’t like, love, or enjoy them.
sn35.136:1.11: When sights perish, fade away, and cease, the Realized One lives happily.
sn35.136:1.12: The Realized One has truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape of sounds …
sn35.136:1.16: thoughts, so he doesn’t like, love, or enjoy them.
sn35.136:1.17: When thoughts perish, fade away, and cease, the Realized One lives happily.”
sn35.136:1.18: That is what the Buddha said.
sn35.136:1.19: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn35.136:2.2: touches and thoughts, the lot of them—

sn35.136:3.1: In all the world with its gods,
sn35.136:4.1: The noble ones have seen that happiness
sn35.136:5.2: the noble ones say is suffering.
sn35.136:5.4: the noble ones say is happiness.
sn35.136:6.1: See, this teaching is hard to understand,
sn35.136:6.3: Those who don’t see are closed off;
sn35.136:6.4: for them, all is blind darkness.
sn35.136:7.1: But those who see are open;
sn35.136:7.2: for the good, it is light.
sn35.136:7.3: Though it’s right there, the unskilled fools
sn35.136:8.1: They’re mired in desire to be reborn,
sn35.136:8.2: flowing along the stream of lives,
